main event: On 11 August 1958, a civilian in Olean, New York reported a round, silver object the size of a normal plate with a loud roar. The object disappeared in the southeast at 5,000 ft after being initially observed in the northwest. The sighting lasted 10 seconds and occurred during the daytime.
interesting points: The object had a loud roar, which was noted at the time of the sighting, suggesting it emitted a significant sound.
The civilian observed the object initially in the northwest before it disappeared in the southeast at 5,000 feet, indicating a significant movement of the object.
The object was described as round, silver, and the size of a normal plate, providing detailed characteristics of the unidentified flying object.
Data was deemed incomplete for analysis, raising questions about the ability to fully evaluate the nature of the sighting.
The conclusion reached was that there was insufficient data for evaluation, leaving the nature of the object unidentified.
sighted object: round, silver object the size of a normal plate
